headline: The Bull Case For Marriott International (MAR) Could Change Following Strong Q3 Results and Upbeat 2025 Guidance
summary: On November 4, 2025, Marriott International reported higher third-quarter revenue and earnings compared to the previous year and provided updated guidance, projecting fourth-quarter gross fee revenues of US$1.38 billion to US$1.40 billion and full-year gross fee revenues of US$5.39 billion to US$5.42 billion. This combination of strong reported results and clear forward guidance highlights both operational momentum and transparency on future expectations for investors. We'll now explore how...

headline: Marriott (NASDAQ:MAR) Beats Q3 Sales Expectations
summary: Global hospitality company Marriott (NASDAQ:MAR) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 3.7% year on year to $6.49 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.47 per share was 3.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Marriott International (MAR) Tops Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Marriott (MAR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +2.49% and +0.55%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Marriott’s Luxury Hotels Help Lift Revenue and Profit
summary: Marriott International narrowed its full-year earnings outlook after logging higher profit and revenue in the third quarter, as ongoing strength in the luxury segment more than offset reduced government travel.

headline: Marriott: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.41 per share. The hotel company posted revenue of $6.49 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts.

headline: Conversions drove Marriott’s Q3 portfolio growth as US RevPAR dipped
summary: Despite weaker demand in lower chain scales, Marriott held its full-year 2025 RevPAR growth outlook steady in the third quarter, and a record pipeline was a bright spot.

headline: McDonald’s Earnings, Tariff Update, Musk Pay Vote: What to Watch This Week
summary: All eyes are on the government shutdown, which is nearing the longest on record. Meanwhile, investors will dig into earnings from McDonald’s, AMD and others. On Thursday, Tesla is due to publish the outcome of its shareholder vote on CEO Elon Musk’s pay package.

headline: ? What Should Investors Expect From Marriott and Airbnb Earnings?
summary: In WSJ’s Take On the Week podcast, reporter Miriam Gottfried speaks with Eric Resnick, CEO of KSL Capital Partners, about the resilience of the travel sector. They discuss what investors should watch for as companies, including Marriott and Airbnb, release earnings this week.

headline: CHRISTMAS WITHOUT THE CHAOS: FOUR POINTS BY SHERATON SINGAPORE, RIVERVIEW LAUNCHES FIRST-EVER CHRISTMAS OFFSITE CATERING SERVICE WITH ISLAND-WIDE DELIVERY
summary: Four Points by Sheraton Singapore, Riverview is transforming holiday entertaining with the launch of its inaugural Christmas Offsite Catering Menus, available from 1 November to 31 December 2025. The new offering brings the hotel's signature festive flavours to homes and offices across the island, featuring curated buffets delivered with hotel-quality care. Guests can look forward to hearty roasts, flavourful sides, and sumptuous desserts that capture the warmth and spirit of the season.
